info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 13 at 3:41AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER ACROSS EXTREME NORTHEAST GEORGIA FROM 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... Although much cooler air will spread into the region today in the wake of a departing cold front, surface dew point temperatures will be very low across northeast Georgia during the afternoon hours. This will result in relative humidity values dipping into the 20 to 25 percent range for several hours this afternoon. In addition, sustained winds from the west and northwest of 10 to 15 mph are expected, with occasional gusts into the 20 to 25 mph range at times this afternoon. These factors will combine with continued very low fuel moisture readings to produce increased fire danger across extreme northeast Georgia this afternoon and into early this evening. Please refer to your local burn permitting authorities on whether you can burn today. If you do burn, use extreme caution since fires can quickly get out of hand under these conditions.
